DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Comparison Blood Radiolabeled Agent Maximum Uptake Ratio Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric value that indicates the maximum ratio between a radiolabelled imaging agent in the tissue and the blood. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tissue Comparison Blood Radiolabeled Agent Maximum Uptake
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._The examination of two or more people or things in order to detect similarities and differences._A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood._Any compound that has been joined with a radioactive substance._An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI)_The largest possible quantity or degree._The absorption by a tissue of some substance, food material, mineral, etc., and its permanent or temporary retention.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.:The examination of two or more people or things in order to detect similarities and differences.:Blood circulating throughout the body.:Any compound that has been joined with a radioactive substance.:An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.
The examination of two or more people or things in order to detect similarities and differences.

A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.
Any compound that has been joined with a radioactive substance.
An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.

Property.preferredDefinition: the largest possible quantity or degree.:The absorption by a tissue of some substance, food material, mineral, etc., and its permanent or temporary retention.

Concepts.definition: The largest possible quantity or degree.
The absorption by a tissue of some substance, food material, mineral, etc., and its permanent or temporary retention.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect._The absorption by a tissue of some substance, food material, mineral, etc., and its permanent or temporary retention._Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI):The absorption by a tissue of some substance, food material, mineral, etc., and its permanent or temporary retention.:The ratio of two or more signals, typically between two channels.  Of type float. (caMAGE):A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.
The absorption by a tissue of some substance, food material, mineral, etc., and its permanent or temporary retention.
Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support U Washington adoption of C3D for FMISO trial.
